'''Tar-Anárion''' was the eighth ruler of [[Númenor]],<ref name=Tar-Anarion/> succeeding his mother, [[Tar-Ancalimë]] (being the first ruling Queen).<ref name=Tar-Ancalime/>

== History ==
Little is said about Tar-Anárion's rule.<ref name=Tar-Anarion/> His two eldest children were female, but both refused to be heirs to the throne for unknown reasons, and they disliked and feared [[Tar-Ancalimë|Ancalimë]], who would in revenge not allow them to marry. Therefore he was succeeded by his son, [[Tar-Súrion]].<ref>{{UT|Wife}}, ''The Further Course of the Narrative'', penultimate paragraph</ref>

== Etymology ==
''Anárion'' is a [[Quenya]] name. Its meaning is not glossed, but Paul Strack suggests it likely means "Son of the Sun" as a compound of ''[[anar]]'' ("sun") and the patronymic suffix ''[[-ion]]'' ("son of").<ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-3208765969.html|articlename=Q. ''Anárion'' m.|website=Eldamo|accessed=27 May 2021}}</ref> Like all the rulers of Númenor who took their royal names in Quenya, Anárion added the prefix ''tar-'' ("high") to his name when he received the [[Sceptre of Númenor|Sceptre]].<ref>{{UT|Kings}}, first paragraph and entry I to XXV</ref>
